overview_of_class: This class will provide an overview of German Expressionism in literature, visual art, and film from the late nineteenth century to the beginnings of World War II, looking at the stylistic and thematic innovations of this period and their continuing influence today. The social context of the period will be discussed, as well as various themes closely related to the development of Expressionism in German culture, including but not limited to: crime and violence, sexuality, madness, the occult, war and trauma, the city, capitalism, the role of ethnic and cultural minorities, the appeal of the exotic, the rise of new technologies, and visions of decadence and catastrophe. Students will also continue to develop their reading, writing, speaking, and listening skills in German on an advanced level.
